messages: e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:00): I'm having problems setting the header strings in a QTreeView. My code is here: http://qtnode.net/pastebin/820
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:00): ahigerd:ok, i changed QDialog  to QMainWindow  in my cpp as well as .h files. It fails to compile though as QMainWindow.exec does not exist
e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:00): tl;dr version: I put strings into a QStringListModel, then set the header's model to that string model
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:01): ahigerd:however Qdialog.exec exists which i use to show the form
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:04): Lews: QTreeView calls model()->headerData(section)
e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:05): I'm a Qt newbie, and don't know what that means. Should I use a different kind of model?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:05): Lews: What that means is that the header is populated by the model and not by a "header model", as far as I can tell. How are you populating the QTreeView?
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:06): ahigerd:can you compile my code?
e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:06): I have a QStringListModel, which I fill with stuff and then set as the model of the tree view
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:06): trumee: QMainWindow doesn't HAVE .exec(); if you NEED QDialog you need to change it in Designer.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:06): Lews: QStringListModel is too primitive to be able to store header data.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:07): Lews: Though you could subclass it and override headerData()
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:07): ahigerd:ah, this is something i dont understand. How can change it in designer
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:07): trumee: Don't quite know. It's something you selected when you first created the file.
e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:07): Do I have to set header data in the tree view's primary model?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:08): Yeah.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:08): ahigerd: :(. i didnt do anything extraordinary
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:09): ahigerd: should i look into .ui file?

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:09): trumee: Hmm, you're not going to like this. I don't think you can change it in Designer without creating a new file. Let me see if it's easy to change it within the .ui file by hand.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:10): ahigerd:right on the top, i see <widget class="QMainWindow" name="InputsDialog" >
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:10): ahigerd:should i change it to Qdialog?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:11): trumee: Yeah, change that to QDialog and delete the QWidget, QMenuBar, and QStatusBar sections.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:11): I think that'll wokr.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:11): work*
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:11): Hmm...
e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:11): OK, I got it working. Thanks!
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:11): Actually, the QWidget section contains your UI, doesn't it?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:11): Lews: No problem.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:12): trumee: Okay, you just want to delete the QWidget line and the /widget tag that closes it; leave everything in between.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:12): ahigerd:ok.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:12): trumee: I'd open it in Designer afterward to make sure the file still works.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:15): ahigerd:it worked after renaming QMainWindow to QDiaolg, i didnt touch QWidget
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:17): ahigerd:is there anything like align left, align right etc for widgets in designer? my form doesnt have widgets aligned very well

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:18): trumee: Well, yeah, it worked, but you've got an unnecessary QWidget on your dialog. And you should be using layouts (select widgets, right-click, Lay Out In ____) instead of manual positioning.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:19): ahigerd:oh ok, i will look into layouts
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:21): trumee: That'll also have the advantage of making your widgets resize appropriately when you resize the window.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:22): ahigerd:i am setting it up :)
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:28): can i make qt app sit in *box slit?
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:30): building qtopia-core 4.1.3 with gcc-4.1.2 for ARM, I get this:
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:30): Stalwart: Same way you do any app. ;)
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:31): arm-linux-gnu-g++ .... arch/arm/malloc.c
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:31): arch/arm/malloc.c:4670: warning: 'mSTATs' defined but not used
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:31): {standard input}: Assembler messages:
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:31): {standard input}:3069: Error: Rn must not overlap other operands -- `swp r3,r2,[r3]'
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:31): make[3]: *** [.obj/debug-shared-emb-arm/malloc.o] Error 1
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:31): o.o()
56029d361cadef136ba8c507a7446027 (02:32): now wtf would gcc do that...
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:32): ahigerd: i never wrote a dockable app

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:33): Stalwart: Neither have I, but you'll have to check the docs for the slit because Qt doesn't offer any specific functionality for it (though if you're good with using the systray instead of the slit there's support for that)
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:35): ahigerd:i lost my menubar when i opened my form in designer
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:35): ahigerd:and if i add menubar again, it does show in preview, so something is screwed up
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:36): trumee: That's because QDialog doesn't support a QMenuBar.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:36): ahigerd:ah, maybe that was the reason. i had a QMainWindow !!
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:36): trumee: Did you keep a backup of your .ui file from back when it was a QMainWindow?
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:36): ahigerd:ok, so i am back to square one :(
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:36): ahigerd:yes i have the backup
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:37): trumee: Then you want to call .show() on the QMainWindow instead of .exec()
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:37): ahigerd:k, let me try
e93e520ca8906d9eebf1df27364c21ba (02:41): Is there any way to make one pane of a QSplitter take up as little space as possible, rather than half the splitter?
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:42): ahigerd:it shows and disappear, how do i make it to stay?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:42): Lews: Check stretch factors in the docs
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:42): trumee: Call exec() on your QApplication object (I'm assuming you're working in main()?)
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:42): ahigerd: i have in main.cpp ,  InputsDialog dlg; dlg.show();
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:43): You should have "return app.exec();" in main.cpp somewhere
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:43): Assuming app is your QApplication object
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:43): ahigerd: i can't use systray - QTestEdit won't fit in it =]
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:43): *QTextEdit
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:44): ahigerd:yup, it works with app.show ()
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:44): ahigerd:i have a VB background, so feel foolish here !
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:45): ahigerd:Does qt has a FileOpenDialog box?
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (02:46): Have a look at the QFileDialog docs
d57c0ed4280cd947377c57e9473bbac2 (02:46): There's a static method for a file open dialog
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:47): Stalwart: Ah, you're doing something like THAT. Yeah, you'll have to look into the docs for the slit.
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:47): Wintre:cheers
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:47): trumee: It's OK; I came in with a VB background too, but I'd worked in Java so I knew about layouts.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:47): trumee: If you haven't yet, I'd recommend working through the tutorial. You'll learn a lot in a big hurry.
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:48): another question - how to make widget height constant? setFixedHeight( height() ); leads to funny result
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:48): Stalwart: height() doesn't return a valid value until the geometry has been calculated. Try sizeHint().height()
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:48): Wintre,ahigerd: is there any place i can learn about hooking signals onto menu bars
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:49): ahigerd:i have done the independent QT tutorial , is there anything else:
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:49): I'm not the person to ask for that one; I actually don't like Designer (probably because I DID have a VB background)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:49): trumee: No, I meant the official one in the docs.
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:49): ahigerd: now that's what i want
782d9ed4bd6ff7ddd65fbfe746aec691 (02:49): thanks
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:50): ahigerd:uh, ok maybe it is on the trolltech page
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:50): ahigerd:dont have docs installed here on my gentoo box :(
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:50): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/tutorial-t1.html
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:51): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1 is the same content as the +doc use flag would have given you.
7073774da7b3e12071ac2edaf3304fb5 (02:53): trumee: doc use flag is very handy :)
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:53): ahigerd:cheers
96fd72f0d7b8ba18cba6384208cd434a (02:53): mobtek:yeah, i have enabled it now

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:53): doxygen doxygen doxygen *yawn* doxygen doxygen...
7073774da7b3e12071ac2edaf3304fb5 (02:54): ahigerd: heh
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (02:57): Don't get me wrong; doxygen is cool. But I hate waiting on it. :P

3168b756735a48d0f13b46ac910779dc (03:00): is it possible, with QGL, to choose another frambuffer id?
3168b756735a48d0f13b46ac910779dc (03:01): it seems, that the stencil buffer doesn't work, opengl also tells me it is 0 bit, and glxinfo says that several of the frame buffers have 0, others 8 bit
